channel.title: Posts on natesmind.space
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on natesmind.space

item.title: Cheaper Than an Ipad
item.description: I’m a college student and last semester did not go very well. I was taking a lot of classes where I had to take physical notes and keep track of a lot of different handouts. Basically I had a bunch of paper that I needed to keep organized. So I went to target bought a binder and some separators for it and started to organize. This worked for a little bit but eventually the paper won the war of attrition.

item.title: Rethinking Smartphone Ui
item.description: Recently I’ve been feeling that the way that I was using my android smart phone is very cluttered compared to how I use my laptop and desktop linux systems. While I was browsing Fdroid I found a possible solution to my problem in a minimalist launcher. Current day android running on my pixel 6 is fine but I wanted something more utilitarian. I find that the multitude of apps within folders and widgets scattered across my home screen is not something that I find pleasant to interface with.

item.title: Jungian Analysis of The New Great Depression by The Moth & The Flame
item.description: The New Great Depression is a great tune by band The Moth & The Flame with a fantastic music video that sparked my interest. Please watch the video and come back if you’re interested in my analysis. Over the past year I have been reading a lot of Carl Jung. I started with Man and His Symbols then moved onto his Red Book. Both were enlightening though I could use another read of both for comprehension and understanding especially The Red Book.
